title: Effigy Mounds National Monument: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do        View of Mississippi River Valley from the overlook at Fire Point. NPS Photo   Â    Begin at the Visitor Center  Access to the Monument's natural and cultural features begins at the visitor center. Stop at the front desk and pick up a brochure containing more information and a map of the hiking trails.  A 15-minute film interpreting the story of American Indian moundbuilding cultures is featured in the center's auditorium. Explore temporary exhibits and a formal museum exhibit displaying ancient Indian artifacts. Hiking Trails  Touring the Monument involves short walks along accessible trails or extended walks along steep hiking trails. Due to the sacred nature of the site as an American Indian burial and ceremonial ground, there are no automobile tours available. Ranger Programs  Regularly scheduled ranger talks and guided tours are offered during the summer months.  Check the calendar page for a listing of programs and times or call ahead at 563.873.3491 ext. 202. Special Programs  Check our calendar page for upcoming special programs and events such as our winter film festival, moonlight hikes, and bird walks.
